item.description:
**Sunset variation** A 2.5 mile hike that starts out at the parking lot on the side of the mountain and up to the cliff face for the beautiful views to the west for hopefully a wonderful sunset!

We'll meet at the parking area near the Yellow tailhead (Tower trail) on the park road off of Rte. 185 at 7 PM. We'll hike up the Yellow trail and make it to the tower or a better spot by 8 PM and watch for the sunset at 8:30 PM. Then we'll hike back down the Yellow trail to the cars before the gate gets locked. We have until at least 9 PM to get to the cars per the ranger. The fist part of the Yellow trail is steep so we'll take it slow. The hike is anticipated to take about 2 hours, including watching the sunset, and we should be done by about 9 PM. A trail map can be found at the park link provided.

*** Please bring a flashlight in case it gets a little dark as we head back to the cars. ***

557 acres with hiking trails on Talcott Mt. Beautiful views from the mountain of 1,200 square miles. A 165 foot tower sits at the top. The state website says the park is in Bloomfield but the bulk of the park with entrance road and tower are in Simsbury.

Directions can be found in the notes area of this event. Kevin S will lead and is the contact for this one. No meal is planned after the hike.

*** There is a 30% chance of isolated thunderstoms in the long range forcast as of 6/28/06 so good chance for sunset. Hope for the best! I'll update here on the forcast as we get closer.***

From I-91 North or South: take Exit 35B, which is the Bloomfield Route 218 exit. This road is also known as Cottage Grove Road. Follow Cottage Grove Road heading west until you hit Route 185. Follow Route 185 heading for Simsbury. At the top of the hill, the entrance to Talcott Mountain State Park/Heublein Tower will be on your left.

From I-84 East or West: take the Route 44 Exit. Follow Route 44 heading west until you hit the junction of Routes 10 and 202 in the town of Avon. Follow Route 10 north until you hit Route 185 in Simsbury. Follow Route 185 heading for Bloomfield. At the top of the hill, Talcott Mountain State Park/Heublein Tower is on your right.

PETS:
Pets on a leash are permitted in picnic areas and on hiking trails.

For more information, see http://dep.state.ct.u...
